No Offence to valve but, this is a lazy port of HL1 to the newer and more advanced source engine. this port has lots of bugs and gltiches, i reccomend instead playing HL1 rather than the Source Port, although i did had fun buggering around with console commands.

Original half life 10/10, looking at Source as its own game it would be a 6/10. But since it is trying to be a "better" version of an incredible game, and fails in the most spectacular way possible makes it a 3/10. Still pretty fun tho

I never thought I'd be praising Half-Life Source but here I am. 

For context, this game is a port of the original 1998 game Half-Life into the Source engine (what Half-Life 2 runs on), instead of remastering or remaking anything however, Valve decided to literally just kinda throw this game into the engine and ship it. Evidently this resulting in a slightly better looking but completely broken game. 

Now I'm a big Half-Life fan, I make an effort to replay it at least once a year and I actually beat the normal Half-Life like 5 days ago and yet last night I beat Half-Life source in one sitting and you know what? I had an enjoyable time. 

The gunplay, although very different from the original, is WAYY more fluid, and similar with that of Half-Life 2. The ragdoll physics of the enemies is also very satisfying and lead to a more responsive experience (although again, less authentic).

On top of that there are tons of small things that make the game much more graphically pleasing from the shininess of metals, the source water effects, and the dynamic lighting of the flashlight, it all looks very nice even if a bit out of place. 

If you are wanting to experience Half-Life for the first time I beg you to just buy the original and play that first. If you aren't willing to play a game that old but still want a half-life experience, buy Black Mesa. If you're a Half Life fan that's looking for a refreshing way to experience the classic and don't care much about broken AI and funny glitches this should be an enjoyable experience.

You know exactly why I don't recommend this

This game is old, and i mean it in all the bad ways. I finished it recently and  i just...

Look, i know that i'll get hated for this, but Half-Life just fails to deliver to that title of greatest game franchise ever made.

The pacing is absurdly slow, the enemy placement reeks of old games with inexperienced devs, the gunplay is just not enjoyable, and the game can be stupidly confusing sometimes about what you have to do. I had to start over in multiple chapters because some important NPC died before telling me what to do.
The maps are huge and yet so claustrophobic, which completely breaks the immersion. The world presented by the game just doesn't feel real, it just feels too much like a videogame, and ironically it's the opposite of what i've been told it is.

Half-life is old. If this review was a retrospective i'd give it a straight 10/10, but from a modern point of view, it just fails to deliver on several aspects.
I don't know. maybe i'm just too young. I want to love this game, i really do, but it just isn't enjoyable for a modern player who didn't grow with it. I felt like i was experiencing a time capsule from an era that i'm glad is over.

I will give HL1 ONE good point though, and it's that it just has this made by Valve feel to it that i really enjoy as a PC gamer. Appart from that, HL is just not good.

TL:DR : Half Life 1 is an old game, in all the bad ways.
Classic FPS, ask your father why this game is great.

The game is straight out of its time, the controls are clunky, and still need to be fixed, but the story is amazing, all that Valve has to do is fix the controls a bit, I am tired of getting stuck some where because the box I need to jump on top of to climb some escalators keeps being pushed by my character even when I do a long jump. So if you grew up with this game, you are probably used to the controls, it is as you remembered, but for modern players, or people who are used to more ease of life controls, yeah no, avoid it.
